casebody.data:
Donald BAXTER, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 18211. United States Court of Appeals District of Columbia Circuit. Argued July 7, 1964. Decided July 23, 1964. Petition for Rehearing en Banc Denied Nov. 9, 1964. Mr. Robert W. MeChesney, Jr. (appointed by this court), Washington, D. C., for appellant. Mr. Anthony A. Lapham, Asst. U. S. Atty., with whom Messrs. David C. Acheson, U. S. Atty., and Frank Q. Nebeker and Victor W. Caputy, Asst. U. S. Attys., were on the brief, for appellee.

Before Fahy, Weight and McGowan, Circuit Judges.

*548PER CURIAM.

The appeal is from a judgment of conviction of robbery, in violation of D.C. Code § 22-2901, and is rested upon the admission of evidence now claimed to have been inadmissible. In view of all the circumstances of the case we think it is not one for the exercise of our discretion permitted by Rule 52(b), Fed.R. Crim.P.

Affirmed.
